args:
Dismayed by Emile's atrocities and lies, the
Waterwyrm decides to forge a new pact with
{player_name}. When Harle tells them
the emperor is trying to kill the Flamewyrm,
the group sets off to her volcanic lair to help.
I don't want to fight you!
What?! How could my dragon lose to\ninsignificant dregs like you?
Get up, you beast! You can still fight!
Silence! Don't you dare mock me!
As if it weren't bad enough being lorded\nover by our other siblings, now I have to\ndeal with YOU? I cannot abide it!
None of you are stronger than me.\nNONE OF YOU! I've barely shown you\na sliver of what I'm capable of.
Aieee! How dare you loose an arrow at\nyour prince!
Whoever did that, show yourself!\nI will crush the life out of you with\nmy own two hands!
Or—if you're smart—you'll stay where you\nare. Lay one more finger on that dragon,\nand I'll put an arrow through your eye.
Why do you come to my defense, sylvan?\nI nearly killed you the last time you\nthought to challenge me.
No, you didn't. I understand that now.\nYou held back and spared me.
The least I can do is return the favor.
And I don't regret challenging you,\nby the way.
I'm proud of risking my life to save the\npeople I love.
He can stand tall because he's willing\nto fight for this world's future even as it\ncontinues to try and crush him underfoot.
Or will you continue to bow to this poor\nexcuse of a master who pummels you like\na common barnyard animal?
You would ask ME that question?
He's right. You're a DRAGON—the most\nrevered of all creatures! You should fight\nfor what YOU want.
Ah, but I already do. I fight for a beautiful\nland of azure seas, which I treasure above\nall else in this world.
Emile promised to use his wealth and\npower to keep the ocean safe.
To hell with your ocean.\nGet up and KILL THEM NOW!
Did you just say ＂to hell with your ocean＂?\nThe very one you swore to protect?
Yes, I did. And so what?!
Let all the water in the world turn to\nswampland. It means naught to me.
You are my slave now, dragon.\nTHAT is what the pact signifies.
Now heed my command and get...on...\nyour...FEEEEEET!
You lied to me, and thus do you dishonor\nthe sacred bond between dragons and\nyour bloodline.
Emile isn't worthy of a pact with you.
Your power isn't meant to be used on\nsuch petty ambitions.
I left the azure seas undefended when I\nrose onto the continent. I must rely on\nsomeone to protect my home in my stead.
I understand how important a home is.
So let ME keep your home safe.\nYou don't need Emile.
But... That's... N-no! You cannot!\nWe have a pact!
You're not allowed to break a pact,\nyou idiot dragon!
Waterwyrm, I swear this to you now:\nso long as I live, no harm will come\nto your ocean home.
Could you be the true heir to dragonblood?
There is only one way to know:\nI will disavow myself of my current pact.
If the Dragon Parting does not kill me and\nreduce me to mana, then I will know it\nwas never a true pact at all.
The Dragon Parting? No... No no no!\nYou cannot do that! I forbid it!
She's actually DOING it. She's trying to\nsever our pact, even if it kills her.\nAnd I hope it does, you stupid lizard!
*huff* *puff* I am still here... Is it done?
Are you all right, Waterwyrm?\nWe should be quick about this.
But first, answer me this,\nPrince of dragonblood...
For what reason do you fight?\nWhy do you seek our power?
To defend all that I love.
I just lost someone dear to me because I\nlacked the strength to protect her.
I can see the resolve in your eyes,\nand I hear no artifice in your voice...
You shine like a true king...\nand you are worthy of my blessing.
I am Mercury, mistress of the tides and\nruler of the waves. I shall be the ocean\nthat carries you!
A pactstone? B-b-but that cannot be!
I was able to break my pact with you\nbecause your motives when forging it\nwere untrue.
You've betrayed me!\nI will never forgive you for this!
A pact is a double-edged sword.\nYou will come to know this in time.
And a small man cannot withstand it.
Haw haw haw! Poor Prince Emile!\nHe's lost his dragon!
Kill these maggots and get my fool\ndragon back!
What are you, Alberius the Founder?\n...Still, a shame you're too late.
Emperor Aurelius has already disbanded\nyour kingdom and is now putting the\nremaining dragons to death.
He would never do that!\n...At least, my father wouldn't.
Smoke is rising from the mountain...\nThat's Mount Adolla! It's erupting!
But that's where the Flamewyrm lives...\nHas the emperor attacked her?!
Correct! He and the Flamewyrm do battle\neven as we speak.
But that is the gravest of sins!\nDragons have long kept our world safe,\nand they are to be revered!
I agree. To lay hand to them would be\nbeyond the pale.
Why does this impostor hate dragons?
What is he trying to do?
You'll have to seek those answers yourself\nat Mount Adolla.
Come, Prince Emile. We are leaving.
Before I go, {player_name},\nlet me leave you with this pretty picture...
The emperor has our dear, sweet sister\nZethia with him.
In fact, she's probably being roasted alive\nat this very moment.
What? Emile, come back here!\nDamn it!
C'mon, {player_name}!\nWe need to get to that volcano before\nanything happens to Zethia!
